title: The Witch's Boy by Kelly Barnhill
description:
When Ned and his identical twin brother tumble from their raft into a raging, bewitched river, only Ned survives. Villagers are convinced the wrong boy lived. Sure enough, Ned grows up weak and slow, and stays as much as possible within the safe boundaries of his familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cottage and yard. But when a Bandit King comes to steal the magic that NedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s mother, a witch, is meant to protect, it's Ned who safeguards the magic and summons the strength to protect his family and community.

In the meantime, in another kingdom across the forest that borders NedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s village lives Ãƒï¿½ine, the resourceful and pragmatic daughter of the Bandit King. She is haunted by her motherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s last words to her: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The wrong boy will save your life and you will save his.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ But when Ãƒï¿½ine and NedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s paths cross, can they trust each other long enough to make their way through the treacherous woods and stop the war about to boil over?

With a deft hand, acclaimed author Kelly Barnhill takes classic fairy tale elements--speaking stones, a friendly wolf, and a spoiled young king--and weaves them into a richly detailed narrative that explores good and evil, love and hate, magic, and the power of friendship.
